I think when you say “purity” you really mean clarity, or the amount of any internal flaws in a diamond. Purity would refer to the atomic composition and how much nitrogen or other impurities (boron, etc) are present, but that requires substantial equipment and is not something GIA or other gem labs evaluate for gem diamonds during grading. Assuming clarity, internal inclusions (flaws) are evaluated by how easy they are to find using 10x magnification. If you have a similar magnification available you can review your diamond but there’s a lot of technique involved and usually requires taking a course with practice diamonds to fully do. I would recommend finding a local GIA accredited gemologist and have them grade the clarity for you. Otherwise if you want to learn more directly, the GIA website has a great explainer page here: GIA 4Cs Clarity Hope that helps.
